----- TELNIX MANUAL PAGE ----- (5) services
Services are a special kind of program that run in the background. You can list them with the "ps" command: > ps dial.service (running) echo.service (running) vault.service (running)
Generally, they accept user input, process the input, and return an output.
You can interact with services using the netcat (nc) command, which will send data to the provided telco service. If you also provide a telco name, netcat will send your data to the specified service on the provided telco. Here are some examples.
Send the data "bar" to the service "foo" on telco5: > nc foo.service@telco5 bar
Send the data "bar" to the service "foo" on the current telco: > nc foo.service bar
Everything after the first argument to netcat is considered data: > nc foo.service This entire sentence is considered data.
Try sending data with netcat to the "echo" service, which will print the supplied data to the console: > nc echo.service hello there hello there ----- END PAGE -----
